titleStmt.title: The plague at Westminster. Or, An order for the visitation of a sick Parliament, grievously troubled with a new disease, called the consumption of their Members. The persons visited are, The [brace] Earle of Suffolke, Earle of Lincolne, Earle of Middlesex, Lord Hunsdon, Lord Barkly, L. Willowby of Parham, Lord Maynard, Sir John Maynard, Master Glyn, Recorder of London. [brace] With a forme of prayer, and other rights and ceremonies to be used for their recovery. Strictly commanded to be used in all cathedrals, churches, chappels, congregations, throughout his Majesties three kingdoms, of England, Scotland, and Ireland.

The plague at Westminster. Or, An order for the visitation of a sick Parliament, grievously troubled with a new disease, called the consumption of their Members. The persons visited are, The [brace] Earle of Suffolke, Earle of Lincolne, Earle of Middlesex, Lord Hunsdon, Lord Barkly, L. Willowby of Parham, Lord Maynard, Sir John Maynard, Master Glyn, Recorder of London. [brace] With a forme of prayer, and other rights and ceremonies to be used for their recovery. Strictly commanded to be used in all cathedrals, churches, chappels, congregations, throughout his Majesties three kingdoms, of England, Scotland, and Ireland.

notesStmt.note: The words "Earle of Suffolke, .. Barkly," and "L. Willowby .. Recorder of London." are bracketed together in parallel columns on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
